title: Boost in outlook draws bulls to Arris
text:
Boost in outlook draws bulls to Arris By David Russell (david.russell@optionmonster.com) 21 hours ago ÓÅ± Done 
Arris popped after raising guidance today, and the bulls are piling in.optionMONSTER's Heat Seeker monitoring program detected the purchase of almost 2,200 February 30 calls for $2.25 to $2.50 today. Volume was 4 times open interest at the strike, which indicates new money was put to work. Long calls lock in the price where investors can buy a stock, allowing them to profit from a rally with limited capital at risk. Their cheap cost can also generate significant leverage on a percentage basis if the maker of telecom equipment moves in the right direction. (See our Education section)ARRS is up 4.04 percent to $27.81 in afternoon trading and was up 9 percent at one point in the session. The rally came after the communications-equipment company said its acquisition of Pace will boost yearly earnings by $0.65 to $0.75 a share, about $0.20 more than initial projections.Investors already liked the $2.1 billion deal, driving ARRS shares to their highest level in more than a decade after it was announced in April. They've skidded lower since and are now back near the bottom of their longer-term range.Total option volume in ARRS is 46 times greater than average so far, with calls outnumbering puts by more than 200 to 1.
